main

Class GameEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.GameEnvironment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Printable

    public class GameEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object
implements Printable
    Main loop for this game. Provides all control methods and calls and advances days. Running this main file will play a command line version of the game. Implements the interface printable which provides the methods required for command line display and input collection
    Author:
    Josh Burt , Nobu Sato

    • Method Detail

      • createGame

        public void createGame()
        Sets up the game and creates pets and players. Before the set up, the game would ask if you like to start a new game or check the instruction. Sets up the game by asking for number of players,number of days, number of pets, pet types. MUST ONLY BE CALLED AT THE START OF THE GAME Provides validation of numbers and only adds 3 players and up to 3 pets per player. Warn the players, if they picked 10 or more days.

      • dailyPetUse

        public void dailyPetUse(Player p,
                        Pet a)
        Performs the actions for each pet daily. If the pet is misbehaving or sick, then it will alert the player. If the pet is dead, then it will go back to playDay method (The player cannot interact with dead pet). The player is given a list of methods, which if the player picks a valid option, it will call the method.
        Parameters:
        p - Player whos pets are in use.
        a - pet to be acted on

      • discipline

        public void discipline(Pet a)
        Disciplines the Pet. By calling this method, the pet's happiness drops to 0, but the pet is no longer misbehaving.
        Parameters:
        a - Pet that needs to be discplined.

      • displayInstruction

        public void displayInstruction()
        Displays an instruction on how to play the game.

      • displayInventory

        public void displayInventory(Player p)
        Prints out all the items available in the inventory. If the inventory is empty, the player will be informed. If there is a duplicate item in the inventory, then it will calculate the number of occurrence of the duplicated item.
        Parameters:
        p - object that needs inventory displayed

      • displayPets

        public void displayPets(Player p)
        Prints off a list of pets and options to move to the next day, use the shop.
        Parameters:
        p - Player who is to have list of pets displayed.

      • feed

        public void feed(Player p,
                 Pet a)
        Allows the Player to feed the selected pet. By calling this method, the player is given a choice of food available in the inventory. If the food does not contain inside the inventory, it will do nothing but lose 1 action point. If the food is given to a pet, the pet's hunger and happiness level go up, but the pet's bladder goes down. If the food given is pet's favourite food, the happiness goes up by 1. The food is removed from the inventory once eaten. If the pet is sick, the pet will not be able to taste the food. The pet gains 1 kilogram after consuming the food.
        Parameters:
        p - Player who's pet is to be feed.
        a - Pet that is to be feed.

      • finalScoreAdjust

        public double finalScoreAdjust(Player p,
                               Pet a)
        Adjusts the scores based on Pet condition on the final day. On the final day, the pet's condition contributes to your final score. If the pet is dead or sick, the player will lose some points. If the pet is misbehaving, the score will not change. If the pet is in perfect condition, it will gain extra points.
        Parameters:
        p - Player who is to have score calculated.
        a - Pet that score is to be accessed.
        Returns:
        Double

      • finalScoreDisplay

        public void finalScoreDisplay(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
        Dispalys the final player scores. Prints off the final score for each player.
        Parameters:
        players - function is passed a list of players whos scores are to be displayed.

      • foodStatusDisplay

        public boolean foodStatusDisplay(Player p,
                                 Food food)
        Prints off the selected food's status. Gives a player a choice to either buy them or not. Meal size depends on the fullness of the food. Also, prints off the cost of the food and the amount of money player currently have.
        Parameters:
        p - Player that is using the shop
        food - food item passed here by the shop.
        Returns:
        Boolean

      • getDay

        public int getDay()

      • getInput

        public java.lang.String getInput()
        Method to implement Printable. opens a Scanner and returns the inputed String Scanner is left unclosed to allow function. Called by getInput()
        Specified by:
        getInput in interface Printable
        Returns:

        public java.lang.String getItemName(Item item)
        Returns a name of the item.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        String.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Provides validation for names by checking uniqueness against any pets currently in game, length and Non-emptiness.
        Returns:
        String.

      • healPet

        public void healPet(Player p)
        The player is given a list of sick pets, with the option to heal them. The player has a choice to heal them or cancel the visit. Checks if the player can currently afford to treat the pet. If the pet is healed, the player loses $10, and the pet is no longer sick and should feel happier.
        Parameters:
        p - Player who's pets are to be accessed.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main function. Each pet gets 2 actions per day. The player is given $20 each day. Depending on the pet's stat, it can change the pet's condition. As each day passes, each stat drops (The bladder will only drop when the pet is sick). Players earn points each day (Unless the pet is dead). Final score is calculated depending on the pet's conditions.
        Parameters:
        args - command line arguments to be passed none exist for this main.

      • nextDay

        public void nextDay()

      • perDayScores

        public void perDayScores(Player p,
                         Pet a)
        Calculates the per day Scores. Each pet's overall stats contributes to the score (Unless the pet is dead). Players earn extra points if the pet is not misbehaving/sick (Pets that are misbehaving earns more points than pets that are sick).
        Parameters:
        p - Player who is to have score calculated.
        a - Pet that score is to be accessed.

      • petStatusDisplay

        public boolean petStatusDisplay(Pet a)
        Prints of the selected pet's status. Player gets a choice of either keeping the pet or choose a different pet.
        Parameters:
        a - pet whos stats are to be displayed
        Returns:
        Boolean

      • play

        public void play(Player p,
                 Pet a)
        Allows the Player to play with the pet using a toy. By calling this method, the player is given a choice of toys available in the inventory. If the toy does not contain inside the inventory, it will do nothing but lose 1 action point. If the toy is given to a pet, the pet's happiness level go up, but energy and hunger may go down. If the food given is pet's favourite toy, the happiness goes up by 1. The toy's durability gets reduced once used (If the toy's durability drops to under 0 then the toy breaks). If the toy breaks, the toy is removed from the inventory. If the pet is sick, it will use up more energy to play. If the pet is misbehaving, it will try to break the toy. If exercise is required to play with the toy, the pet will lose 1 kilogram, hunger and energy. (Hunger and energy depends on the exercise level).
        Parameters:
        p - Player who's pet is to be played with
        a - Pet to be exercised

      • playDay

        public void playDay(Player p)
        Provides the calls to use daily actions. The player gets a choice of either... interacting with one of the pets go to the shop check the inventory move to the next day. Gives an error message if the player didn't pick a valid option.
        Parameters:
        p - Player who is to start the daily loop.

      • printDay

        public void printDay()
        Prints the current day number. Prints off which day the players are currently on.

      • printHeader

        public void printHeader()
        Specified by:
        printHeader in interface Printable

      • printToScreen

        public void printToScreen(java.lang.String displayString)
        Prints a message to the output stream. Method to implement Printable.
        Specified by:
        printToScreen in interface Printable
        Parameters:
        displayString - string to be printed

      • purchaseFood

        public void purchaseFood(Player p)
        Gives a player list of food available to them. Player gets a choice of either buying them or cancel the visit. Once the player picks a valid option, it will show the status of the food and has a choice to buy them or not. Checks if the player can afford the food. If chosen to buy the food, the food will be added to the inventory and the player will lose some money (Depending on the price).
        Parameters:
        p - Player who's currently using the shop.

      • purchaseToy

        public void purchaseToy(Player p)
        Allows Player to purchase Toys. Player gets a choice of 6 different toys. Player can choose to either buy the toy or cancel the visit. Checks if the player can afford the toy. If the player picks a valid option, it will show a status of the toy and the player can choose to buy them or not. If the player has chosen to buy them, the toy gets added to the inventory and lose some money (Depending on the price).
        Parameters:
        p - Player who's currently using the shop.

      • revivePet

        public void revivePet(Player p)
        Gives the player the option to revive any dead pets. The player is given a list of dead pets (Pet died as a zombie will not be on this list). Players cannot revive a zombie. Player can either revive them or cancel the visit. When the pet gets revived, the player loses $30, and the pet turns into a zombie and is no longer dead. Also, checks if the player currently has enough money to revive them. The pet's stat remains the same.
        Parameters:
        p - Player who's pets are to be accessed.

      • setDailyCondition

        public void setDailyCondition(Player person)
        Performs the daily game action for each Player to set up their day. Each pet gets 2 actions per day. The player is given $20 each day. Depending on the pet's stat, it can change the pet's condition.
        Parameters:
        person - Player whos pets daily condition change need to happen on.

      • setDay

        public void setDay(int newDay)

      • setPetCondition

        public void setPetCondition(Pet animal)
        Displays the attribute status for selected pet. Each pet gets 2 actions per day. If the pet has neutral happiness or hunger, the pet will start misbehaving. If the pet has low hunger, bladder, or energy, the pet will get sick. If the pet weighs 3 kilogram, the pet will get sick. If any stats drops to 0, the pet will die. If the pet gets sick, the pet is no longer misbehaving. If the pet dies, then the pet is no longer misbehaving or sick.
        Parameters:
        animal - pet whos stats are to be changed

      • sleep

        public void sleep(Pet a)
        Sleeps the Pet to increase energy. By calling this method, the pet's energy increases to maximum (10). If the pet is misbehaving, the pet will not sleep properly.
        Parameters:
        a - pet that is to sleep.

      • statDrops

        public void statDrops(Pet animal)
        Calculates and impletments daily stat drops for pets. Each pet drops stat such as energy, happiness, and hunger level. If the pet is dead, then the stats will not drop. If the pet is sick, then the bladder stat will also drop. If the pet weighs more than 10 kilogram, the pet will get hungrier than usual.
        Parameters:
        animal - pet whos stats are to be changed

      • status

        public void status(Pet a)
        Display status of the Pet. By calling this method, it prints of the status of the given pet.
        Parameters:
        a - Pet thats score is to be calculated.

      • toyStatusDisplay

        public boolean toyStatusDisplay(Player p,
                                Toy toy)
        Prints off the selected toy's status. Gives a player a choice to either buy them or not. The exercise level varies depending which toy it is. Also, prints off the cost of the toy and the amount of money player currently have.
        Parameters:
        p - Player that is using the shop
        toy - toy that is passed here by the shop.
        Returns:
        Boolean

      • useShop

        public void useShop(Player p)
        Starts the shop. Open up the shop by asking which section of the shop the player is willing to visit. Player also have an option to exit the shop (return to playDay method).
        Parameters:
        p - Player who is to use the shop

      • useToilet

        public void useToilet(Pet a)
        Increases Pets bladder satisfaction. By calling this method, the pet's bladder should change to maximum (10). The pet loses 1 kilogram after visiting the bathroom.
        Parameters:
        a - Pet who is to use toilet
